getWritableDirectoryWithFailovers

public static java.io.File getWritableDirectoryWithFailovers(java.lang.String... directories)
                                                      throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
Gets the first writable directory that exists or can be created.

Parameters:
directories - The directories to try
Returns:
A File object that represents a writable directory.
Throws:
java.io.FileNotFoundException - Thrown if no directory can be written to.

ensureDirectoryWriteable

public static java.io.File ensureDirectoryWriteable(java.io.File logDir)
                                             throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
Try's to create a directory and ensures that it is writable.

Parameters:
logDir - The File object to check.
Returns:
The File object passed in for chaining call to it. This value will never be null.
Throws:
java.io.FileNotFoundException - Thrown if logDir is null, exists, is not a directory, cannot be created, or cannot be written to.
